moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Na5: ? What is the thinking behind this move which is not standard. On the face of it, Black is losing development and a tempo. The chessgames.com database has White winning 53% of games where this move has been tried, of the 47 on its database against 15% for black.
moves.4. c3: ! the right move, taking advantage of Black's Knight's foray to the edge of the board to seize the centre. White wins 60% of the games from this position according to chessgames.com
moves.4... a6 5. Ba4 e6 6. O-O: White already has a significant advantage with better central control and a development lead. Fritz8 assessment is White +0.7 of a pawn.
moves.6... b5 7. Bc2 Bb7 8. d3 Nf6 9. Re1 Be7: ! best move now that d5 is no longer available for the Black Knight.
moves.11... Nd7: White is getting things ready for an assualt on the Kingside and meantime that Black Knight is still on a5...
moves.12. d4: ! best move opening the line of the Bishop and locking in the Black Bishop.
moves.12... b4 13. cxb4 cxb4 14. b3: 14 Bd3! Rc8 15 Nf1 Nc6 16 Ng3 o-o 17 Nh5 with an advantage for White
moves.14... Nc6 15. Nf1 a5 16. Ng3 Qb6 17. Be3:
?!
This Knight is in the mood for exotic travel in this game , see a few of the chess board's less well-trodden corners! 
The computer recommends 17 .. h5 18 h4 Rc8 19 Ng5 Bxg5 20 hxg5 g6 21 Rc1 Ba6 with White retaining an advantage
moves.18. Bd3 Ba6 19. Rc1 Bxd3 20. Qxd3 Nb5 21: ?! Better apparently is Re2 - as played the text allows Na3.
moves.21... Na3 22. Rcc1 h6: ! Good prophylactic move. 22 .. o-o?! allows 24 Bg5
moves.23. Nh5 O-O: For a long time Fritz considered 23 .. o-o the best move for Black - took it a long time to find  the sacrifice which shows the strength of White's play. o-o looks respectable. In fact the best move available for Black is Bf8 though it has to be said its very ugly.
moves.24... Rfc8:
Blacks best try here is 
24 .. 'g6 25 Bxh6 gxh5 26 Qf4 f5 27 exf6 e.p Bxf6 
(27 .. Rxf6 28 Qg3+ Kf7 29 Ng5+ Ke8 30 Nxe6 1-0) 
28 Bxf8 Rxf8 29 Qc7 Qxc7 30 Rxc7 and White has a winning end game
moves.25... gxh6 26. Qxh6 Bf8: anything else loses on the spot
moves.28... Nxf6 29. exf6 Rxc1 30. Qh5+:
winning - its mate in 13.
interestingly, Qh4+ wins for Black! just shows how careful you have to be in these situations. 
After 30 Qh4+ Bh6 31 Ng5+ the King can come to g6 and Black wins after 31 .. Kg6 32 Rxc1 Bxfg5 when Black is 2 pieces up. 
Just shows you
Kg6 isn't possible with the Q on h5!
Mate follows after some manoeuvring with 31 Rxc1 Qa6 32 Qg5+ Kh8 33 Qh4+ Kg8 34 Qg4+ Kh8 35 Qh3+ Kg8 36 Ng5 1-0
